intro: Scaphyglottis purpusii, commonly known as the purple-stemmed marsh orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, showcasing adaptations to waterlogged soils. Its flowers are usually pale green to purple in color, with three sepals and three petals, and it produces small, rounded seed pods. Scaphyglottis purpusii is often found in association with other wetland plants, contributing to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
